intro: Sida tiagii, commonly known as the Hawaiian sida, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as a herb or shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its small, white or pink flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. Sida tiagii is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii and is often found in moist, open habitats.
